posts.post_content:
I have been holding this Johnson, hands at chest, for a few months now for a fellow member.  Which I have no problem doing.  However, unfortunately, I have deleted the email and forgot who I was holding it for.  We'll hold off on senility and dangling participle jokes for now .... :rolleyes:

If "you're" out there and still want card, please email me:  [url]mybuddyinc@yahoo.com[/url]

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=215029&d=1450302325[/IMG]

Thanks, Scott
Man how could I have forgotten :rolleyes:

I'm collecting this back run, but it wasn't me.  Just wanted to mention since I'd be a likely candidate for being interested in this pose. 

Good luck finding the person though! 

Cheers, 
Steve

Forget grammar and senility jokes, this is the gem right here:

[quote name="mybuddyinc" post=1482272]I have been holding this Johnson ... for a few months[/QUOTE]

:D

And with hands at the chest...time to contact the Guinness Book of World Records.  And anyway you are supposed to seek medical attention after four hours.

Brian
I owned this one for a few years!

[quote name="brass_rat" post=1482281]I'm collecting this back run, but it wasn't me.  Just wanted to mention since I'd be a likely candidate for being interested in this pose. 

Good luck finding the person though! 

Cheers, 
Steve[/QUOTE]

How bout those who don't own a Johnson period Steve :(

[quote name="Joshchisox08" post=1482472]How bout those who don't own a Johnson period Steve :([/QUOTE]

Not having a Johnson could prove problematic.

[quote name="Bocabirdman" post=1482473]Not having a Johnson could prove problematic.[/QUOTE]

I see what you did there ! :D

I have a very strict policy:  I will NOT allow other board members to hold my Johnson, nor will I hold their Johnsons.

It avoids these types of awkward situations.

Therefore, I know that this one can't be mine.

HAHA -- forgot about impending "Johnson" jokes :):)

All is now fine --- I have found the "member" :rolleyes:

[quote name="mybuddyinc" post=1482553]HAHA -- forgot about impending "Johnson" jokes :):)

All is now fine --- I have found the "member" :rolleyes:[/QUOTE]

Scott I'm glad that you found your member :)

This brings back memories of the time when I drank too much Patron, wanted to look at my cards and for some reason decided to pull out my Johnson. The next day when I couldn't remember where I stuck my Johnson the night before I was so scared.  I can't tell you the relief I felt when I learned I had at least put it in a protective sleeve and put it in the same nice and cozy space it had been so many times before.  That could have been a very costly mistake.  Years later me and my Johnson are still together but I'm very careful where I put him now.  Let this be a lesson to you all.
